result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen P Curtis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stephen P Curtis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stephen P Curtis was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Stephen P Curtis was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch

Defendant Stephen P Curtis in court with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Christine M. Genda appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&3. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence on count 2, $443 costs, on ct. 3, $673.50 fine,  60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. No jail credit. Ct. 1 dismissed.
